articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party, State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Party, State Leaders
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, sent messages to party leaders and heads of state of different countries in reply to their congratulatory messages to him on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They included the president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic who is chairman of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the president of the Syrian Arab Republic, the Palestinian president who is chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization and the president of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party.
					
					 Kim Jong Un in the messages wished them greater successes in their responsible work for developing parties and achieving prosperity of their countries and expressed his conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and their countries would steadily develop.

articles.title: Head of WPK Delegation Addresses Int'l Meeting of Communist, Workers' Parties
articles.content:
Head of WPK Delegation Addresses Int'l Meeting of Communist, Workers' Parties
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), made a speech on Nov. 8 at the 15th international meeting of communist parties and workers' parties in Lisbon, Portugal.
					 He led the WPK delegation to the meeting.
					
					 He, in his speech, expressed belief that the meeting would offer an important occasion in powerfully encouraging the world progressive people in their struggle to successfully advance the cause of socialism against imperialism and boosting the unity and solidarity among the communist parties and workers' parties in various countries.
					
					 Noting the imperialists have become evermore undisguised in their moves for aggression and plunder, high-handed and arbitrary practices in various parts of the world in a bid to save their fate from declining, he went on:
					
					 The imperialists are seeking a way out of their daily worsening economic and financial crises in aggression and war moves against other countries and ratcheting up their political and military pressure, economic sanctions, psychological warfare and interference in other's internal affairs. 
					
					 The present international situation urgently calls on all communist parties and workers' parties in the world to support and cooperate with one another and boost the bonds of solidarity, firmly adhering to independence, and resolutely frustrate the hostile forces' infringement upon sovereignty.
					
					 In this sense, we fully support and approve this meeting which adopted as its main agenda item the issue of dynamically pushing forward the cause of socialism to counter the desperate offensive of imperialism.
					
					 Socialism suffered a temporary painful setback due to the moves of the imperialists and opportunists in the 90s of the last century but is still alive in the hearts of the progressives for its truth as a science and its just cause is sure to triumph.
					
					 The WPK is highly proud of the fact that it has covered the road of steady development for a long period since it explored the path of socialism centered on the popular masses in line with its own faith and determination.
					
					 The WPK is now ushering in a new great heyday in all fields of socialist construction under the banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as it has supreme leader Kim Jong Un as its first secretary.
					
					 Kim Jong Un clarified new truth of history that Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the guiding idea of the WPK, is, in essence, the idea of considering the popular masses as the most important beings and pursues the policy of genuine love for people by placing their interests above all and regarding them as absolute.
					
					 Monumental edifices in the era of Songun conducive to the cultural and emotional life and health of the people are springing up in various parts of the DPRK and that the country is turning into a highly civilized socialist nation. This eye-opening reality is bringing joy, happiness and vibrant life to its people.
					
					 The Korean people more strongly oppose aggression and war and more ardently love peace than any others as they have been exposed to the ceaseless war drills and constant nuclear threat and blackmail of the U.S. 
					
					 The WPK has made responsible and sincere efforts, prompted by its will to defuse the tension on the Korean Peninsula and contribute to ensuring peace and security in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 It sets store by the support and solidarity of the communist parties and workers' parties in various countries in its just struggle for security in the Korean Peninsula, the world's biggest hotspot, and lasting peace in the region.
					
					 It will as ever join efforts with the communist parties and workers' parties in the world and wage a positive struggle to defend peace and security on the peninsula and in the rest of the world and win the victory of the human cause of independence and the cause of socialism.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I express once again profound thanks to the communist parties and workers' parties including the Communist Party of Portugal and people in various countries for extending invariable support to the WPK and the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 He expressed firm belief that the meeting would mark an important occasion in powerfully demonstrating the unity and solidarity among the communist parties and workers' parties in various countries for the victory of the cause of socialism.

articles.title: Greetings to Angolan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Angolan President
Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday  sent a message of greeting to Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of the Republic of Angola, on the occasion of the 38th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the president greater success in his work for consolidating the national unity and achieving economic development and expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to PM of Swaziland
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to PM of Swaziland
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Barnabus Sibusiso Dlamini upon his reappointment as prime minister of Swaziland.
					 The message wished him greater successes in his responsible work for the country's economic development.

articles.title: Reception Given on Anniversary of Diplomatic Relations between DPRK, Nordic Countries
articles.content:
Reception Given on Anniversary of Diplomatic Relations between DPRK, Nordic Countries
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs Monday gave a reception on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Nordic countries.
					 Present there on invitation were the ambassadors and staff of the Swedish, Finnish and Norwegian embassies and the political councilor of the Danish embassy here.
					
					 Present there were Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung and other officials of the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Human Rights Abuses
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities are desperately resorting to the operations to lure and abduct inhabitants of the DPRK and conspiratorial plots against it by use of defectors from the north, human scum, despite its repeated warnings.
					 Recently even the chief executive and the prime minister of south Korea staged such burlesque as praising defectors from the north. 
					
					 This is a blatant challenge to the dignity and social system of the DPRK and unpardonable political provocation and hideous crime unprecedented in history, Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 All cases of abduction of DPRK inhabitants were premeditated criminal operations directly spearheaded by the south Korean authorities. 
					
					 "Protection of defectors from the north" and "universally accepted human rights" touted by the south Korean authorities to cover up their crimes are nothing but sophism no longer workable. The testimonies made by those who returned home after being lured and taken to south Korea lay bare shuddering human rights abuses of the puppet authorities. 
					
					 South Korean people's resentment at the conservative group's illegal interference in the "presidential election" and its moves to revive "yusin" dictatorship is now running high. Much upset by this, the puppet regime is becoming evermore desperate in its operations to abduct inhabitants of the DPRK and hatch plots against it in a bid to stoke atmosphere of confrontation with fellow countrymen and tide over its crisis by diverting elsewhere the public criticism of it. 
					
					 It is quite natural to punish the criminals and terrorists keen to hurt the social system and lives and security of people in the DPRK. It is in full line with international law and norms on protecting human rights and combating terrorism. 
					
					 Nam Jae Jun, director of the puppet Intelligence Service, and other diehard confrontation maniacs are the primary target of punishment as they are taking the lead in these operations and conspiratorial plots.

articles.title: U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Lambasted
articles.content:
U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Lambasted
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the spokesman for the U.S. State Department claimed as regards the six-party talks that north Korea should keep its promise for denuclearization and that it is necessary to give priority to the advance step for denuclearization. He also said that there is no change in this stand of the U.S. government.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Action for action remains as the basic principle of settling the nuclear issue. The DPRK will not unilaterally move first to resume the six-party talks.
					
					 The U.S. is taking issue with the DPRK, contending that Pyongyang has not abandoned its nuclear program as it promised to do in the September 19 joint statement, but it is the U.S. which reneged on its promise and defaulted on its duty.
					
					 After its emergence, the Obama administration adopted it as its policy to mount a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK. It has openly threatened and blackmailed the DPRK while introducing strategic forces such as nuclear strategic bombers and nuclear carriers into the Korean Peninsula in a rotating way and ceaselessly staging nuclear war exercises to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 The pending issues between the DPRK and the U.S. still remain as empty commitments due to the U.S. reckless hostile acts.
					
					 The escalating U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail and moves for a war against the DPRK are a grave encroachment upon its vital rights and sovereignty in wanton violation of the DPRK-U.S. agreements and the September 19 joint statement in which the U.S. promised neither to use any armed forces including nuclear weapons against the DPRK nor to threaten it with them.
					
					 The DPRK will not take a denuclearization step first to resume the talks unless the U.S. shows in action its willingness to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Russia Offers Medical Apparatuses, Medicines to DPRK
articles.content:
Russia Offers Medical Apparatuses, Medicines to DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The government of the Russian Federation offered medical apparatuses and medicines to the DPRK.
					 There took place a ceremony here on Monday to hand over medical apparatuses and medicines which Russia offers to the DPRK gratis through the World Health Organization (WHO).
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, the Russian ambassador to the DPRK and the representative of the WHO here.

articles.title: Scientists, Technicians Tour Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Scientists, Technicians Tour Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Participants in a national meeting of scientists and technicians visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They laid flowers before the graves of the President's grandparents Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik and his parents Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok and paid silent tribute.
					
					 They looked round the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum and the native home of the President, being briefed on the historical relics preserved there.
					
					 They also visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong. They paid floral tribute to Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					 Making the round of the cemetery, they renewed their resolution to be loyal to supreme leader Kim Jong Un and make a dynamic offensive to make a breakthrough in the latest science and technology with many scientific and technological achievements by learning after the fighting spirit and traits of the revolutionary martyrs.
					
					 They visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum and paid homage to the statue of Kim Il Sung acknowledging the cheering crowds at a square where the military parade was held to mark the victory in the war.
					
					 They presented flowers to the sculpture "Victory" in the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War and paid respect to the victors of the great annals.
					
					 Going round several halls of the museum they learnt about the undying exploits Kim Il Sung performed for the victory in the war and leader Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary feats.
					
					 They toured the Central Mushroom Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, Okryu Children's Hospital and Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory and enjoyed the performance of the Korean People's Army Song and Dance Ensemble.

articles.title: Mosaics Portraying Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Different Parts of DPRK
articles.content:
Mosaics Portraying Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Different Parts of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Mosaics "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Will Always Be with Us" and "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Will Always Be with Us" were erected in Munchon City, Kangwon Province, Riwon, Jangjin, Pujon, Hochon and Yodok counties, South Hamgyong Province and Tongchang County, North Phyongan Province. They depict the beaming images of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					 President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il visited Munchon City several times, giving specific instructions to bring about a turn in the work of the city including production, construction and the improvement of the standard of people's living and wisely led the drive to carry them out.
					
					 They provided field guidance to Riwon County, setting forth tasks to develop local industry and agriculture, plant trees and preserve and manage well historic and cultural relics.
					
					 Jangjin, Pujon, Hochon, Tongchang and Yodok counties are associated with the undying feats they performed by clarifying the position and role of county in socialist construction and turning the remote mountainous counties into regional bases linking urban and rural areas and places where people enjoy  happiness.
					
					 The mosaics erected at the Songjin Fireproof Material Factory and the Kubin Stockbreeding Cooperative Farm in Pyongyang depict Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il visualizing a rosy future of Juche Korea on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Ceremonies for unveiling the mosaics were held at the relevant units.

articles.title: Gym, Fitness Facilities in Munsu Water Park
articles.content:
Gym, Fitness Facilities in Munsu Water Park
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The Munsu Water Park here has fitness facilities and gymnasium in its Indoor Wading Pool.
					 The gymnasium with a pyramid-shape roof has two stories with volleyball, basketball and badminton courts on the ground floor.
					
					 Choe Un Sim, a guide of the gymnasium, told KCNA:
					
					 Trampolines and mountain-climbing practices are very popular among visitors.  
					
					 On the first floor, there are a bowling alley and fitness rooms equipped with body-building apparatuses.
					
					 Han Jong Nam, an officer of the Korean People's Army who took part in building the water park, told KCNA:
					
					 At the beginning of the project, the construction of the gymnasium was not planned.
					
					 When the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un dropped in at the construction site of the water park, he said there would be sports enthusiasts among the visitors to the water park, so it would be good to build a gymnasium in the park for them. 
					
					 After receiving his instruction, the soldier-builders built this splendid gymnasium in a little more than one month. 
					
					  The visitors to the Indoor Wading Pool can also build their bodies with over 10 kinds of sports apparatuses in the fitness rooms.
					
					 Ryu Song Il living in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang told KCNA:
					
					 Body-building apparatuses are excellent. I feel refreshed.

articles.title: Friendly Match between DPRK, Indonesian Men's Footballers
articles.content:
Friendly Match between DPRK, Indonesian Men's Footballers
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A men's friendly football match between the DPRK April 25 Team and the Indonesian national team took place here on Sunday.
					 The Indonesian national team is on a visit to the DPRK at the invitation of the DPRK April 25 Team.
					
					 The match ended in 2:0 with victory for the April 25 Team.
					
					 At the end of the match, Jacksen F Tiago (Brazilian), chief coach of the Indonesian national team, told KCNA that they gained good experience in the match with the April 25 Team, highly praising its players for their good job.
					
					 He said:
					
					 We will develop exchange with DPRK teams in the future.
					
					 It is the first of its kind that the DPRK April 25 Team and the Indonesian national team had an exchange.
					
					 The April 25 team is one of the strongest in the DPRK. It made good results in domestic games including the premier soccer matches for the DPRK Championship held in October this year.
					
					 The Indonesian national team will have a preliminary match with the Chinese rival to be qualified for the 2015 Asian Cup.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Football Team Is Strongest in East Asia: FIFA
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Football Team Is Strongest in East Asia: FIFA
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, FIFA posted an article titled "October Review of Int'l Women's Football" on its website, in which it praised the DPRK women's football team as the strongest in East Asia. 
					 The article said the DPRK women's football team won the first place in the 6th East Asian Games held in Tianjin, China without a single goal allowed for its rivals.
					
					 The team led by chief coach Kim Kwang Min recorded 3 wins in the league matches of four U-23 women's football teams, thus consolidating its position as one of the strongest teams in East Asia, the article said, and continued: 
					
					 As announced by FIFA, the DPRK women's team showed its high ability in the 6th East Asian Games, admired by experts and fans.
					
					 The DPRK team beat its Chinese team 1:0, China's Taipei team 7:0 and the Japanese team 2:0, scoring 10 goals in total.
					
					 It also won the 2013 East Asian Cup in July.

articles.title: Legends about Mt. Chilbo (1)
articles.content:
Legends about Mt. Chilbo (1)
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- There is Mt. Chilbo, called "Mt. Kumgang in North Hamgyong Province" for its superb scenic beauties, on the southern coast of the province, the DPRK.
					 The mountain is divided into three areas, Outer Chilbo, Inner Chilbo and Sea Chilbo.
					
					 The mountain tells about a legend well known among the local people.
					
					 Once upon a time, fairies from heaven used to have bath in small ponds of Unson Valley in Outer Chilbo. 
					
					 Not far from the valley, a young man called Ji Un Song were living with his blind mother.
					
					 One day, when Ji was dressing a cod, he happened to discover a heptangular mirror in it. Upon hearing the story how he got the mirror, his blind mother told him to keep it well for its owner.
					
					 A few months later, Ji came to meet a girl sobbing near a pond while picking edible herbs in the valley. The girl told him she was a fairy from heaven and lost her heptangular mirror when having a bath in the pond.
					
					 Ji handed the mirror back to the fairy with the story how he got it, so that the fairy could fly up to heaven.
					
					 The king of heaven highly praised the fairy for getting back the mirror and presented her a necklace decorated with seven jewels.
					
					 As the days go by, however, the fairy had become languished with love for Ji. 
					
					 No one knew the reason, so the king had a conversation with her to get to know that she was sighing for a young farmer called Ji.
					
					 After receiving the allowance from the king, the fairy flew down to the valley with her mirror and necklace, with which she restored the sight to Ji's blind mother. 
					
					After marrying Ji, the fairy renamed herself Chilbo (seven jewels) Fairy.

articles.title: New Chinese-Korean Translation Programs Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Chinese-Korean Translation Programs Developed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- A research group of Kim Chaek University of Technology of the DPRK recently developed new Chinese-Korean translation program. 
					 In this regard, Department Director Ha Jong Bok of the State Science and Technology Commission, which sponsored the 24th National Software Contest and Exhibition from Oct. 29 to Nov. 4, told KCNA:
					
					 The program for translation of scientific and technological books presented to the contest and exhibition drew attention from visitors.
					
					 Chief Kim Tong Gwon of a section of the IT Institute of the university, when interviewed by KCNA, said:
					
					 The program is characterized by its high accuracy and speed in translation as it is based on up-to-date technology currently used in different scientific research organs.
					
					 On display in the exhibition were also Chinese-Korean translation programs presented by research groups of Kim Il Sung University, the Central Information Agency for Science and Technology and Pyongyang University of Computer Science.
					
					 The programs will be helpful to scientists and technicians in consulting Chinese scientific and technological books.

articles.title: Japanese Figures Urge Government to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Japanese Figures Urge Government to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Tokyo, November 10 (KNS-KCNA) -- Japanese figures including Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and Seizaburo Ekuchi, representative of the Tokyo-Pyongyang Rainbow Bridge, visited the Cabinet of Japan on November 6 and conveyed to it a written request calling for friendship between the DPRK and Japan and the normalization of relations.
					 In the request they urged the Japanese government to lift sanctions against the DPRK and apply the tuition waiver program to the Korean schools in Japan.
					
					 They held that Japan should abandon the hostile policy toward the DRPK and opt for normalizing the relations according to the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Halt Moves to Shut Down Jaju Minbo
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Halt Moves to Shut Down Jaju Minbo 
						
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Shutdown of Jaju Minbo of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 8 demanding the authorities stop the moves to shut down the progressive paper.
					 At the press conference, the speakers denounced the Park Geun Hye regime's moves to shut down Jaju Minbo reporting truth as a revelation of a dictatorial action to eliminate all forces and media not to its liking.
					
					 Absolutely unpardonable is the authorities' attempt to shut down Jaju Minbo which has called for a peaceful solution to the deteriorated north-south relations and opposed a war, they said, adding: 
					
					 The people should not allow the shutdown of the paper which has taken the lead in the actions to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the milestone of reunification, and achieve national prosperity.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime's despicable attitude to blind and gag the people and turn south Korea into a land of darkness is also intolerable.
					
					 They called upon all compatriots at home and abroad to turn out in the struggle to protect Jaju Minbo from actions of the Park regime which is disclosing its true colors as a dictatorial one, violating even the freedom of media. 
					
					 A statement was read out at the press conference.
					
					 The statement noted that Jaju Minbo has worked hard for the independence and dignity of the nation and the peaceful reunification of the country, adding that crackdown on it is an act of going against them. 
					
					 The forces hell-bent on dictatorial suppression including moves to disband the Unified Progressive Party and close media will not be able to escape judgment by history, it warned.

articles.title: Crackdown on Progressive Political Party Condemned in S. Korea
articles.content:
Crackdown on Progressive Political Party Condemned in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Members of the local assemblies from the Unified Progressive Party of south Korea protested the puppet regime's moves to dissolve a political party.
					 They held a press conference outside the building of Chongwadae, the puppet presidential office, on Nov. 8.  The "government" railroaded the motion calling for judging the dissolution of the party through the "State Council meeting". This is an expression of crackdown upon the opposition party and a move to destroy the political party, they said, adding:
					
					 The crackdown upon the party, a prelude to Park Geun Hye's dictatorship, is crude violation of democracy.
					
					 Park tried hard for more supporting votes while crying out for the "unity of the people" during election campaign. Now she is working hard to split up the people.
					
					 They urged Park to drop the motion calling for judging the dissolution of the party, make an apology to the people and immediately stop the dictatorial rule.
					
					 On Nov. 7, they staged a collective hair-cutting action at Seoul Square.
					
					 They would not overlook suppression of the progressive political party by those who took power by an illegal and corrupt way, they declared.
					
					 Then they staged a demonstration.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Accuse Puppet Regime of Suppressing Progressive Party
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Accuse Puppet Regime of Suppressing Progressive Party 
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society and the Bar Association for Democratic Society held a meeting in Seoul on Nov. 8 to denounce the puppet authorities' moves to coercively disband the Unified Progressive Party (UPP). 
					 Speakers said that the Park Geun Hye regime cooked up the plotted rebellion against the UPP to calm down the public anger caused by the Intelligence Service's interference in the election, and made a motion calling for disbanding the UPP. 
					
					 In particular, the motion was passed through the "State Council meeting" without the meeting of undersecretaries and with a short time given for investigation, a big procedural mistake, they said. 
					
					 They held it was intended to suppress freedom of thinking and oppress political activities of the progressive forces, adding that the authorities' attempt to disband the party has entered the phase of practical implementation.
					
					 It is an important task facing the civic and public circles to energetically launch the actions for freedom of political activities, they added.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Its Moves to Dissolve Political Party
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Its Moves to Dissolve Political Party
						
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Representatives of 59 civic and public organizations of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 6 at which they declared illegal and null and void the motion calling for the judgment on disbanding the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) that passed through the puppet State Council meeting.
					 This is because the so-called attempted rebellion which the authorities cited as the ground for dissolving the political party cannot be regarded as a crime as it has not yet gone through the first trial, they held.
					
					 It is also because the programme of the UPP does not contain any element going against law, they said, adding it is illegal to label the party's programme which calls for politics for workers and peasants as lawbreaking.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime is resorting to such unreasonable actions in a bid to conceal the acts of interfering in the election by power organs being disclosed one after another and bring the present chaotic situation under control, they noted.
					
					 If the UPP, which secured the position of the second opposition party with people's support, is forcibly dissolved by the present regime as its political retaliation and a remedy to get rid of its crisis, democracy will be ruthlessly trampled down in this land, they held.
					
					 Park would be well advised to refrain from violating democracy any longer, they warned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The November issue of the Romanian newspaper Romania Muncitoare carried a gist of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party."
					 The work, made public on January 3, Juche 81 (1992), indicates that a historical lesson drawn from socialist construction is that it is necessary to steadily strengthen the driving force of the revolution with faith in socialism and a correct idea while adhering to the socialist principle and boosting the comradely unity and cooperation on the basis of independence.
					
					 It clarifies the idea that it is the general line of the Workers' Party of Korea on building socialism to thoroughly carry out the three revolutions--ideological, technological and cultural--while consolidating the people's government and steadily enhancing its function and role. The work also explains its validity.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Progressive Forces under Fire in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Suppression of Progressive Forces under Fire in Foreign Countries 
 Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Danish and Italian figures released statements on November 1 to condemn the south Korean puppet group's fascist suppression of the progressive forces.
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said that the south Korean authorities' brutal suppression of the progressive political party and organizations is aimed at violating genuine democracy and stifling progressive forces.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 This is not a simple issue of a political party, organization and personal figures but a serious one concerning the south Korean people's political freedom and democratic rights.
					
					 I demand the south Korean regime stop the suppression of the progressive forces at once and guarantee freedom of all political parties and organizations.
					
					 A member of the Italian Branch of the Korean Friendship Association noted that the south Korean reactionaries' tyrannical action is designed to benumb the consciousness of independence of the popular masses under the signboard of "democracy", adding that it is an act of cruelly trampling down the will of all Koreans to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a jefes de partido y Estado de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a jefes de partido y Estado de varios paises
 Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio mensajes de respuesta a los jefes de partido y Estado de varios paises quienes le enviaron cartas de felicitacion con motivo del 68o aniversario de la fundacion del PTC. 
					 Entre los destinatarios figuran el secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao, el presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, el presidente del Comite Ejecutivo de la Organizacion de Liberacion Palestina y del Estado de Palestina y el presidente del Partido FRELIMO. 
					
					 En las misivas, el Mariscal les deseo a los destinatarios mayores exitos en sus trabajos responsables para el fortalecimiento y desarrollo de los partidos y la prosperidad de los respectivos paises y expreso la conviccion de que seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y varios paises.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente angoleno
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente angoleno 
 Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este lunes un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Angola, Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, con motivo del 38o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais. 
					 El remitente desea al mandatario mayores exitos en su trabajo para consolidar la unidad nacional y lograr el desarrollo economico y expresa la conviccion de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia la politica hostil a RPDC de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia la politica hostil a RPDC de EE.UU.
 Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En cuanto a las conversaciones a 6 bandas, el portavoz del Departamento de Estado de Estados Unidos dijo que "el Norte de Corea (Republica Popular Democratica de Corea) debe cumplir la promesa de desnuclearizacion" y "priorizar la medida previa para el respecto" y agrego que "es invariable la posicion del gobierno de EE.UU.".
					 En un comentario divulgado este lunes, el diario Rodong Sinmun subraya que tanto en el pasado como en el presente la accion vs. accion es el principio fundamental para la solucion del problema nuclear y que la RPDC no actuara nunca unilateralmente para reiniciar las conversaciones a 6 bandas.
					
					 EE.UU. cuestiona que la PRDC no cumple la promesa de desnuclearizacion aunque la hizo a traves de la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre, pero, el verdadero incumplidor de la promesa y del deber es precisamente EE.UU., critica el comentario y continua:
					
					 Despues de tomar el poder, la administracion Obama politizo el ataque preventivo nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					 Introdujo de modo circular en la Peninsula Coreana los bombarderos nucleares estrategicos, portaaviones nuclear y otros armamentos estrategicos y libra incesantemente los ejercicios de guerra nuclear contra la RPDC ejerciendo la abierta amenaza y chantaje sobre ella.
					
					 Debido a los imprudentes actos hostiles de EE.UU., no se resuelven los problemas pendientes entre ambas partes. 
					
					 La creciente amenaza y chantaje nucleares y los preparativos de guerra anti-RPDC devienen una grave violacion a la soberania y al derecho a la vida de la RPDC y a los acuerdos RPDC-EE.UU. y la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre en que el segundo comprometio a no usar las armas nucleares y otros armamentos contra la primera ni amenazarla con armas.
					
					 Si EE.UU. no demuestra con accion la voluntad de retirar la politica hostil a la RPDC, esta no tomara jamas las medidas previas de desnuclearizacion para el reinicio de las conversaciones.

articles.title: Partido de amistad entre futbolistas coreanos e indonesios
articles.content:
Partido de amistad entre futbolistas coreanos e indonesios 
 Pyongyang, 11 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La seleccion nacional masculina de futbol de Indonesia que visito a Pyongyang por invitacion del equipo masculino 25 de Abril de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, realizo el dia 10 el partido de amistad.
					 En el partido, el once coreano vencio por 2 a 0 al equipo indonesio al marcar dos goles a eso de 5 minutos y 36 minutos de la primera parte.
					
					 El entrenador responsable de la seleccion indonesia, Jacksen F. Tiago (brasileno), dijo a la ACNC que adquirio buenas experiencias a traves del partido en Pyongyang y evaluo altamente las actividades de los jugadores del equipo 25 de Abril de Corea.
					
					 Expreso su voluntad de activar el intercambio con los equipos de futbol coreanos. 
					
					 El intercambio entre el equipo 25 de Abril de Corea y la seleccion nacional de Indonesia se realizo por primera vez.
					
					 El equipo coreano mencionado es el mejor del pais que ocupo el primer lugar en  la competencia de categoria A del Campeonato Nacional efectuada en octubre y gano buenas notas en otras competencias principales. 
					
					 La seleccion indonesia realizara pronto el partido eliminatorio con el once chino para ganar boleto al Campeonato de Futbol por la Copa Asiatica 2015.
